summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions and statements on Liberia and West Africa,

Welcoming President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf's progress in rebuilding Liberia,

Applauding actions leading to Charles Taylor's transfer to the Special Court for Sierra Leone,

Welcoming Liberia's progress in implementing the Governance and Economic Management Assistance Program,

Applauding Liberia's commitment to transparent management of forestry resources,

Stressing the need for appropriate forestry legislation,

Taking note of a moratorium on timber exports and new concessions,

Welcoming cooperation with the Kimberley Process Certification Scheme,

Stressing the importance of the UN Mission in Liberia (UNMIL),

Taking note of the UN Panel of Experts' report,

Reviewing measures imposed by resolution 1521 (2003),

Determining that the situation in Liberia continues to threaten international peace and security,

Acting under Chapter VII,

1. Decides not to renew the measure preventing import of Liberian round log and timber products,
2. Decides to review this decision after 90 days and reinstate measures unless forestry legislation is passed,
3. Urges speedy adoption of forestry legislation,
4. Renews measures imposed by paragraph 6 of resolution 1521 (2003) for six months,
5. Requests the Secretary-General to renew the Panel of Experts' mandate for six months,
6. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
